gov.nasa.arc.mct.components
Class AbstractComponent

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.arc.mct.components.AbstractComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
CollectionComponent
public abstract class AbstractComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

The superclass of every component type. A component is uniquely identified by its id. Subclasses must be created by the platform before usage within the system, this is done using the ComponentRegistry. A component indicates that it has persistent state by providing an instance of ModelStatePersistence through the getCapabilities method. Important subclasses must have a public no argument constructor.

getWorkUnitDelegate

public AbstractComponent getWorkUnitDelegate()
Returns the work unit delegate if any for this component. A work unit delegate will be persisted instead of this component. This is generally only useful to views that are owning properties of other views or components.

Returns:
work unit delegate or null if there is no delegate

public java.util.Set<ViewInfo> getViewInfos(ViewType type)
Returns the views for the desired view type. This method will apply the PolicyInfo.CategoryType.FILTER_VIEW_ROLE policy and the PolicyInfo.CategoryType.PREFERRED_VIEW policy before returning the appropriate list of views.

Parameters:
type - of view to discover.
Returns:
views that are appropriate for this component.

setId

public void setId(java.lang.String id)
Sets the ID of this component. The framework calls this method automatically. It should never be called by plugin code.

Parameters:
id - the new ID for the component

isLeaf

public boolean isLeaf()
Tests whether the component is currently a leaf.

A leaf component is defined as a component that will never have any children. This is an immutable property of a component instance and must not change during its lifetime. The default implementation returns false (thus the default component will be a container), a subclass that should identify itself as a leaf should override this method and return true.

Returns:
true, if the component is currently a leaf. False otherwise.

Parameters:
owner - the user ID of the owner of the component

addDelegateComponent

public final void addDelegateComponent(AbstractComponent childComponent)
Adds a new delegate (child) component. The model of the new delegate component will be added as a new delegate model, and all view role instances will be updated. The new child will be added after all existing children. If the child is already present, this will move the child to the end.

Parameters:
childComponent - the new child component

componentSaved

public final void componentSaved()
This method is invoked by the persistence provider when the component is saved to the underlying persistence store. The implementation delegates to the viewPersisted method.

getReferencingComponents

public java.util.Collection<AbstractComponent> getReferencingComponents()
Gets the components which are referencing this component. Currently, only delegate components are considered. The result of this method is transient and thus requires overhead for each execution.

Returns:
collection which can be empty but never null of components which reference this component.

canBeDeleted

public final boolean canBeDeleted()
Determine by policy if this component can be deleted.

Returns:
true if this component can be deleted, false otherwise.

addDelegateComponents

public final boolean addDelegateComponents(java.util.Collection<AbstractComponent> childComponents)
Adds new delegate (child) components to this component. The model for each component will be added as a delegate model, if not already present. Then, all view roles will be updated by sending an AddChildEvent for each new delegate added. The child will be added at the end of any existing children. If the child was already present, this will move the child to the end.

This method is called when a drop of one or more components happens in the directory tree. The canvas area of this component is unaffected.

Parameters:
childComponents - the collection of delegate components to add
Returns:
true if childComponents are added successfully; otherwise false.

addDelegateComponents

public final boolean addDelegateComponents(int childIndex,
                                           java.util.Collection<AbstractComponent> childComponents)
Adds new delegate (child) components to this component. The model for each component will be added as a delegate model, if not already present. Then, all view roles will be updated by sending an AddChildEvent for each new delegate added. The child will be added at a given index among the existing children. If the child was already present, this will move the child to the new position.

This method is called when a drop of one or more components happens in the directory tree.

Parameters:
childIndex - the index with the children to add the new component, or -1 to add at the end
childComponents - the collection of delegate components to add
Returns:
true if childComponents are added successfully; otherwise false.

addDelegateComponentsCallback

protected void addDelegateComponentsCallback(java.util.Collection<AbstractComponent> childComponents)
Invoked after any of the addDelegateComponents methods are invoked. The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
childComponents - that were added.

removeDelegateComponent

public final void removeDelegateComponent(AbstractComponent childComponent)
Removes a delegate (child) component from this component. The model of the delegate component is removed as a delegate model. Then, all view roles are updated by sending a RemoveChildEvent.

Parameters:
childComponent - the delegate component to remove

removeDelegateComponents

public void removeDelegateComponents(java.util.Collection<AbstractComponent> childComponents)
Removes delegate (child) components from this component.

Parameters:
childComponents - the delegate components to remove

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Get the human readable name for this component that is suitable for displaying to the user in a GUI. If the display name has not been set, the component ID will be returned. Note: this method should not be relied on to retrieve component IDs (or other component type specific identifiers such as PUI IDs).

Returns:
the display name of the component.

getExtendedDisplayName

public java.lang.String getExtendedDisplayName()
Get the human readable name for this component that is suitable for user display. This method differs from getDisplayName() as this method will be invoked when many components are being presented together and having additional information may help the user distinguish components whose display name varies by only a small amount. For example, this method may be used in presenting search results that may have the same display name so this method will be invoked to help differentiate the results in the interface. The default implementation of this method will invoke getDisplayName().

Returns:
a string representing the extended display name

getExternalKey

public java.lang.String getExternalKey()
Gets the external key for this component if it exists.

Returns:
key used outside MCT if it exists, null otherwise

setExternalKey

public void setExternalKey(java.lang.String key)
Sets the external key that allow MCT components to generically reference external entities. How this is used outside MCT is considered behavior of the component and will be described further by the component author.

Parameters:
key - used outside MCT

name - the new display name

Parameters:
name - the new display name

getCapability

public final <T> T getCapability(java.lang.Class<T> capability)
Gets an instance of the capability. A capability is functionality that can be provided by a component dynamically. For example, functionality that can be provided only before a component has been initialized, doing this using inheritance would require introducing an exception into the method signatures and additional semantic documentation. The capabilities provided are specific to the component type and are not constrained by the platform.

Type Parameters:
T - Class of the capability
Parameters:
capability - requested from the component
Returns:
an instance of the capability requested or null if not provided

handleGetCapability

protected <T> T handleGetCapability(java.lang.Class<T> capability)
Provides subclasses a chance to inject capabilities. The default implementation does nothing by returning null. There are no requirements on component providers to add capabilities.

Type Parameters:
T - Class of the capability
Parameters:
capability - requested from the component
Returns:
an instance of the capability requested for null if not available
See Also:
getCapability(Class)

Provide multiple capabilities for a capability class.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:

Returns:
list of capabilities

public java.util.List<AbstractComponent> getComponents()
Get a list of all components to which this component refers. Generally, a referenced component may be thought of as a child of the referencing component, but the precise interpretation of the relationship may vary among component types and view types.

Returns:
a list of all referenced components

Returns:
ordered list of property descriptors
